com.gea.gui

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gea.gui.Component
      • com.gea.gui.Button

  • public class Button
extends Component
    This Button class represents a button that shows text and can react to mouseclicks.
    You can manipulate properties of instances of this class, like font, text, position, width and height.
    You can also store other necessary information for response to mousclick by adding, updating and retrieving stored information.
    Author:
    Joakim

      • isInRange

        public boolean isInRange(int mouseX,
                         int mouseY)
        Checks if the mouse is within the bounds of the button
        Parameters:
        mouseX - - the x position of the mouse
        mouseY - - the y position of the mouse
        Returns:
        true - if the mouse is within the bounds of the button
        false - if the mouse is not within the bounds of the button

      • addStoredInformation

        public void addStoredInformation(java.lang.String informationTitle,
                                 java.lang.Object information)
        Adds a new object to the list of stored information in this button
        and makes it associated with the given key
        Parameters:
        informationTitle - - a string you want to be associated with the object.
        Should be something easy to remember
        information - - the object you want to store

      • updateStoredInformation

        public void updateStoredInformation(java.lang.String informationTitle,
                                    java.lang.Object information)
        Updates an object with specified key, if the specified key exists
        Parameters:
        informationTitle - - the key for the object you want to replace
        information - - the object you want to replace the existing object with
